Package application

Class Game

java.lang.Object
application.Game
public class Game extends Object

The Game class implements all the necessary utilities of the hangman game.

The Game object represents a whole game from start to finish. It is characterized by the word that has been chosen randomly from the dictionary. It keeps track of the current state of the letters that have been guessed by the player, the total points, the total right Guesses, the percentage of the tight Guesses of the player. The basic utility is the "guess" method which is called avery time the player makes a move in order to go to the next state.

Author:
Anastasios Papazafeiropoulos, 03118079

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String word, application.Dictionary dict)

      It initializes all the values of the class and saves in the words array all the words of length equal to the word (the answer of the game). It also initializes the initial state (List of characters) to "_". Each character in the list symbolizes the state of the letter. If it is "_" then the player has not found the letter. If it is an actual letter then the player has found it.

      Parameters:
      String - The answer of the game
      Dictionary - The dictionary used in game

  • Method Details

    • guess

      public boolean guess(int p, Character c)

      Implements the letter guess move of player

      First it increases the total number of tries by one. Then it checks if the answer is true or false by checking directly the letter of the according position in word string of answer. Lastly, initialize a hash set which will be needed in order to calculate the new words list which contains the possible answers.

      If the answer is true

      Increase rightGuesses by one. Then, check for the words in the hash set which have different letter in the position of the guessed one. If it is different then remove words form the set. In other words, we update the "words" list accordingly. Then, calculate the possibility of the guessed letter and add points accordingly.

      If the answer is false

      Update the possible words list by implementing the opposite logic of that above. Then, decrease lives by one and also the total points by 15.

      At the end update the possible letters that are shown to the player by calling the createLetters method of the same class. Lastly, calculate/update the percentage of right guesses.

      Parameters:
      Integer - Integer indicating position of letter guess
      Character - Character actually guessed by the player
      Returns:
      Boolean Boolean : if the guess is right. False if the guess is wrong

    • getPositions

      public List<Integer> getPositions()
      Get the positions remaining to be guessed right. This is helpful for updating the drop down menu for position select in the GUI.
      Returns:
      List Returns a list of all the positions remaining not found.

    • getLetters

      public List<Character> getLetters(int position)
      Get the letters that are possible answer for a specific position. It is used in the drop down menu for letter select in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      int - The specific position
      Returns:
      List Return a list of possible letters of specific position

    • createLetters

      public void createLetters()
      Create array of List of Pairs where the Pair is a letter and its frequency and List corresponds to the Pairs of specific position.

    • lettersString

      public String lettersString()
      Create the String that is going to appear in the GUI. It represents all the possible letters of each position, sorted in descending frequency order. It uses the letters array of the class.
      Returns:
      String

    • printLetters

      public void printLetters(int position)
      Method to print all possible letters of specific position. Used in debugging.

    • printWords

      public void printWords()
      Method to print all remaining words. Used in debugging.
